text: Charles Dillon (Casey) Stengel was a famous baseball player and manager. He managed 3 teams in the MLB the Los Angeles Dodgers, New York Mets and the New York Yankees. He also played for the Dodgers, San Francisco Giants and the Boston Braves. His grandmother was the brother of the famous judge, John Forrest Dillon. == Retired Numbers == Casey's number 37 was retired by the Yankees in 1970. Also by the Mets in 1967 ; World Series won 1922, 1949, 1950, 1951, 1952, 1953, 1956, 1958 == Teams == ===Player=== *Brooklyn Dodgers/Robins (1912-1917) *Pittsburgh Pirates (1918-1919) *Philadelphia Phillies (1920-1921) *New York Giants (1921-1923) *Boston Braves (1924-1925) ===Manager=== *Brooklyn Dodgers (1934-1936) *Boston Braves (1938-1943) *New York Yankees (1949-1960) *New York Mets (1962-1965) Category:1890 births Category:1975 deaths Category:American baseball players Category:Sportspeople from Missouri
title: Casey Stengel
